0.1.Title: Readable String Abbreviation
0.1.Description:
Strings are abbreviated to at least "minlength" characters, such that they remain unique
(if they were). The abbreviations should be recognisable.
0.1.Author: Sigbert Klinke [aut, cre]

1.0.Title: Functions to perform Approximate Bayesian Computation (ABC)<U+000a>using simulated data
1.0.Author: Katalin Csillery, with contributions from Michael Blum and<U+000a>Olivier Francois
1.0.Description: The 'abc' package provides various functions for parameter<U+000a>estimation and model selection in an ABC framework. Three main<U+000a>functions are available: (i) 'abc' implements several ABC<U+000a>inference algorithms, (ii) 'cv4abc' is a cross-validation tool<U+000a>to evaluate the quality of the estimation and help the choice<U+000a>of tolerance rate, and (iii) 'postpr' implements model<U+000a>selection in an ABC setting. All these functions are<U+000a>accompanied by appropriate summary and plotting functions.

Three main<U+000a>functions are available: (i) 'abc' implements several ABC<U+000a>inference algorithms, (ii) 'cv4abc' is a cross-validation tool<U+000a>to evaluate the quality of the estimation and help the choice<U+000a>of tolerance rate, and (iii) 'postpr' implements model<U+000a>selection in an ABC setting. 1.3.Title: Tools for Approximate Bayesian Computation (ABC)
1.3.Author: Katalin Csillery, Michael Blum and Olivier Francois
1.3.Description: The package implements several ABC algorithms for<U+000a>performing parameter estimation and model selection.<U+000a>Cross-validation tools are also available for measuring the<U+000a>accuracy of ABC estimates, and to calculate the<U+000a>misclassification probabilities of different models.

2.0.Title: Tools for Approximate Bayesian Computation (ABC)
2.0.Author: Katalin Csillery, Louisiane Lemaire, Michael Blum and Olivier Francois
2.0.Description: The package implements several ABC algorithms for<U+000a>performing parameter estimation, model selection, and goodness-of-fit.<U+000a>Cross-validation tools are also available for measuring the<U+000a>accuracy of ABC estimates, and to calculate the<U+000a>misclassification probabilities of different models.

2.1.Title: Tools for Approximate Bayesian Computation (ABC)
2.1.Authors@R:
c(
person("Csillery", "Katalin", role = "aut", email="kati.csillery@gmail.com"),
person("Lemaire", "Louisiane", role = "aut"),
person("Francois", "Olivier", role = "aut"),
person("Blum", "Michael",
email = "michael.blum@imag.fr", role = c("aut", "cre")))
2.1.Description:
Implements several ABC algorithms for
performing parameter estimation, model selection, and goodness-of-fit.
Cross-validation tools are also available for measuring the
accuracy of ABC estimates, and to calculate the
misclassification probabilities of different models.
2.1.Author:
Csillery Katalin [aut],
Lemaire Louisiane [aut],
Francois Olivier [aut],
Blum Michael [aut, cre]
